Description: Refresh and solidify understanding of core Java concepts for technical interviews.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Explain difference between JDK, JRE, and JVM
• Demonstrate 4 access modifiers (public, private, protected, default)
• Code difference between == and .equals()
• Explain String immutability with examples
• Compare String, StringBuilder, StringBuffer
• Checked vs Unchecked exceptions
• Final, finally, finalize() keywords

Description: Master OOP principles and apply them to test automation frameworks.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Implement Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction
• Create Page Object Model classes (Encapsulation)
• Method overloading vs overriding
• Abstract class for BasePage
• Interface for test data providers
• IS-A vs HAS-A relationships
• Compile-time vs runtime polymorphism

Description: Master Collections to efficiently manage test data and dynamic structures.
Acceptance Criteria:
• Collection vs Collections
• ArrayList vs LinkedList vs HashSet vs TreeSet
• HashMap vs Hashtable vs ConcurrentHashMap
• Test data management utility
• Filtering, sorting, mapping, reducing
• Custom comparator
• Excel/JSON to collections

Description: Understand concurrency for parallel execution and robust error handling.
Acceptance Criteria:

• Custom exceptions (ElementNotFound, etc)
• Try-catch-finally blocks
• Throw vs throws
• ThreadLocal for WebDriver (Parallel execution)
• Synchronized blocks/methods
• Wait/notify/notifyAll
• Thread-safe Singleton pattern
• ExecutorService

Description: Practice essential Java coding problems for technical interviews.
